results.title: Out of the past = Build my gallows high
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tourneur, Warren B. Duff and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: At the centre is the noir theme of a man’s destructive obsession with a femme fatale. The possibility of redemption is offered by the presence in a pastoral retreat of the safe, undemanding woman. The film’s special hallucinatory quality has its bases in Mitchum’s restrained playing and narration as the fated hero. Tourneur brings a downbeat, tragic other-worldliness to the complex flashback structure in which the past gradually overtakes the present. Photographer Nicholas Musuraca makes disconcerting use of deep shadow. Cast includes Robert Mitchum, Jane Greer, Kirk Douglas, Rhonda Fleming and Richard Webb. Based on the novel “Build my gallows high” by Geoffrey Homes.

results.title: Burnt by the sun = Utomlynonnye solntsem
results.creator_credit: Nikita Mikhalkov, Camera One, Canal+ and Studio Trite
results.brief_description: Set in the Russian summer of 1936, “Burnt By the Sun” is a splendid film about the human damage wreaked by the Stalinist purges, and the betrayal of the revolutionary hopes of the Soviet people. Colonel Serguei Kotov is a military hero of the Bolshevik Revolution who is surrounded by loving family and comrades. In this ideal existence arrives a stranger, Dimitri, who represents the cold, indifferent face of Stalin’s terror. Slowly Kotov realises he is enmeshed in a senseless and violent maze from which there is no escape. Beautifully shot and executed, “Burnt By the Sun” is a study in the creeping paranoia and madness of a regime which has lost sight of its roots and lost sight of humanity. By encapsulating the drama of betrayal, corruption and totalitarianism in the personal struggle of Kotov to make sense of what it happening to himself and his family, this film offers both a powerful examination of the Stalinist era as well as acknowledging the impossibility of any one film, any one document being able to fully represent the horror of a period in which millions lost their lives, their dreams and their sanity. Academy Award winner for Best Foreign Language Film. In Russian with English subtitles.

results.title: Hawks and sparrows = Uccellacci e uccellini [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: In Pasolini’s picaresque serio-comic fable-essay-confession on the theme of social justice, a father and son set out to emulate St. Francis of Assissi’s mission to convert the birds to Christianity. Wandering the Italian landscape, they encounter a wise talking crow, who follows them along retelling left wing parables. Cast includes Toto and Ninetto Davoli. Musical score by Ennio Morricone.

results.title: On golden pond
results.creator_credit: Mark Rydell, Bruce Gilbert and ITC Films
results.brief_description: Cranky 80-year-old retired professor Norman Thayer makes his annual pilgrimage with his wife, Ethel, to their New England summer lake-side home. Their solitude is interrupted, however, when their daughter, Chelsea, arrives with her new fiancee and his son, Billy, in tow. The three generations collide, but after persuading Norman and Ethel to mind Billy, Chelsea and fiancee leave for a romantic European holiday. What begins as a stubborn battle of wills between Norman and Billy, slowly turns into the relationship Norman never had with his own daughter. However, it is through this warm and accepting relationship with Billy that both Norman and Chelsea are finally able to display affection towards one another. Cast includes Katharine Hepburn, Henry Fonda, Jane Fonda, Doug McKeon and Dabney Coleman.

results.title: Can we do this?
results.creator_credit: Brian Grazer, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Tom Hanks, Clavius Base and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
On April 12, 1961, Russia launched the first man into space leaving a stunned American Space Program in limbo. A call to arms by President John F. Kennedy revitalises the sleeping giant and the nation is united by one aim: to be the first to land a man on the moon before the decade’s end. The Mercury program is launched on May 5th, 1961 when Freedom 7 takes Alan B. Shepard, Jr for a 15 minute, 22 second flight into outer space. However, there’s a lot to be learned in a short time before man can actually go the distance. Astronauts like Jim Lovell, Buzz Aldrin, Ed White, Neil Armstrong and more will have to risk their lives before the first Apollo can reach for the skies.

results.title: Apollo 1
results.creator_credit: Brian Grazer, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, David Frankel, Clavius Base and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
January 27, 1967. In preparation for the flight of Apollo 1, astronauts Gus Grissom, Ed White and Roger Chaffe undergo a routine test in their space capsule. The test turns into a disaster when a small electrical fire becomes a raging inferno - the lives of three men lost before they even leave the ground. The nation mourns, but the ever-watchful Senate Committee - anxious over the extreme haste and massive expenditure involved in the project thus far - may pull the plug on the entire Apollo project.

results.title: We have cleared the tower
results.creator_credit: Brian Grazer, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Clavius Base and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
19 months and six unmanned flights after the Apollo 1 tragedy, Wally Schirra, Don Eisele and Walt Cunningham are set to become the first trio of American astronauts in space on Apollo 7 - their preparations followed every step of the way by a keen, young documentary crew. Noone can afford to make a mistake that might endanger the life of the mission or the lives of the men.

results.creator_credit: Brian Grazer, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Clavius Base and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
In a year marked by anti-Vietnam war prtesets, when Russia seemed ready to send a man to the moon, Frank Borman, Jim Lovell and William Anders prepare for the launch of Apollo 8, the first ever manned voyage to the moon. Their aim is to reach the moon and remain in lunar orbit, the greatest risk is that they have a single engine that must break their orbit if it is to bring them home safely.

results.title: Once upon a time in the west = C'era una volta il West [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Sergio Leone, Fulvio Morsella, Paramount Pictures, Rafran and San Marco
results.brief_description: Leone took classic themes of the western revenge story and the coming to the Frontier of civilisation in the form of the railroad and reshaped them into a fresco-like narrative neither revisionist nor traditional. Western stereotypes are abstracted in a West so self-consciously relocated in fable and fantasy that it has been suggested by David Thomson that Leone at heart harboured a contempt for the genre. He and his writers certainly brought European sensibility to bear on American classicism frequently citing classic Hollywood westerns while dilating time and lingering on atmospherics at the expense of cause and effect, clarity and classical economy. Essential to the film’s affect is a symmetry between image and music (Morricone’s four basic musical themes were used to pace and construct scenes throughout the shooting) in an operatic “dance of death” in which “the arias are not sung, they are stared”. Cast includes Claudia Cardinale, Henry Fonda, Jason Robards, Charles Bronson and Gabriele Ferzetti.

results.title: Across the Pacific
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Jack Saper, Jerry Wald, First National Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from the ‘Saturday Evening Post’ serial of the same name name by Robert Carson, this taut World War II thriller reunites the stars of John Huston’s earlier hit,’ The Maltese Falcon’. Humphrey Bogart plays Rick Leland, a tough, cynical Army officer given a bogus dishonorable discharge and sent undercover to hook up with Japanese sympathisers on the eve of Pearl Harbour. Aboard a freighter bound for the Orient, he plays a ticklish game of matching wits with the enigmatic Dr. Lorenz (Sidney Greenstreet), spiced by the presence of the mysterious and beautiful Alberta Marlow (Mary Astor). Huston made this film the year after making his directorial debut with ‘The Maltese Falcon’, and like that classic, this film is full of cool and subtle characters, sharp dialogue, and a plot chock full of twists and turns.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Huston, Jack Saper, Jerry Wald, First National Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.description: Adapted from the ‘Saturday Evening Post’ serial of the same name name by Robert Carson, this taut World War II thriller reunites the stars of John Huston’s earlier hit,’ The Maltese Falcon’. Humphrey Bogart plays Rick Leland, a tough, cynical Army officer given a bogus dishonorable discharge and sent undercover to hook up with Japanese sympathisers on the eve of Pearl Harbour. Aboard a freighter bound for the Orient, he plays a ticklish game of matching wits with the enigmatic Dr. Lorenz (Sidney Greenstreet), spiced by the presence of the mysterious and beautiful Alberta Marlow (Mary Astor). Huston made this film the year after making his directorial debut with ‘The Maltese Falcon’, and like that classic, this film is full of cool and subtle characters, sharp dialogue, and a plot chock full of twists and turns.
